question_content.barrons:question: A ________ of errors led to a major malfunction in the operating system.
question_content.barrons:explanation:
concatenation; chain.

A concatenation (series of interconnected things) or chain of errors could well lead to a malfunction (failure to work properly).

Condemnation is incorrect. Condemnation means censure. A condemnation of errors should not lead to a malfunction of the operating system.

Paucity is incorrect. Paucity means lack or dearth. A lack of errors should not lead to a malfunction of the operating system.

Cancellation is incorrect. Cancellation means a decision to stop something. A cancellation of errors should not lead to a malfunction of the operating session.

Taxonomy is incorrect. Taxonomy is the science or technique of classification. The word makes no sense in the context.
